channel.title: Get Canvas/DC in minimized program?
channel.description:
I would like to do this in Delphi, but i don't think its possible :D..please help me out
If you can do this in any language i would like to know how :D...java it can be done by directly getting it from the java application, but I am not dealing with java..
I need to get the minimized DC of a flash game.
Thanks

item.title: Get Canvas/DC in minimized program?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“ChArMz, post:11, topic:262083”]benlands SMART is completely different, he gets the DC directly from java(runescape)

EDIT: freddy give me the source to scars GetPage, INDY is a bitch, please, be nice to me[/quote]

if it is a java applet you wish to grab the canvas image from, you can use javaagents grab the image then send it to your other application somehow.

this means it can be done in a browser without the user knowing!

Read full topic

item.title: Get Canvas/DC in minimized program?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Freddy1990:

It can’t be done, at least certainly not in Windows XP, me and cruel spend ages researching this problem without any results. One of the issues is that the window isn’t drawn when minimized, and even if you manage to force it to draw it still won’t work, it will only work for off-screen windows.

Yes you can, the theory can be imported from vista. It works perfectly.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 14-02-2009, 23:40:27[/size][hr][quote=“ChArMz, post:8, topic:262083”]so there is no way to do it in XP, even if you figure out the vista hook?

so does vista read the backbuffer of the program?..if so cant we do that in any OS?[/quote]

look @ benlands program for scar

Read full topic

item.title: Get Canvas/DC in minimized program?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Yes, Vista presumably reads the DC of the program, but it will only be updated while minimized if the app draws directly to it’s own DC, instead of using the conventional WM_PAINT message, as the WM_PAINT message isn’t sent while the app is minimized.

Read full topic

item.title: Get Canvas/DC in minimized program?
item.dc:creator: @charmz ChArMz
item.description:
@charmz wrote:

so there is no way to do it in XP, even if you figure out the vista hook?

so does vista read the backbuffer of the program?..if so cant we do that in any OS?

Read full topic

item.title: Get Canvas/DC in minimized program?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:6, topic:262083”]It can’t be done, at least certainly not in Windows XP, me and cruel spend ages researching this problem without any results. One of the issues is that the window isn’t drawn when minimized, and even if you manage to force it to draw it still won’t work, it will only work for off-screen windows.[/quote]Correct, however as Ollie stated, windows Vista has a hook which will allow you to do this.

No idea on how to go about it though.

Read full topic

item.title: Get Canvas/DC in minimized program?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

It can’t be done, at least certainly not in Windows XP, me and cruel spend ages researching this problem without any results. One of the issues is that the window isn’t drawn when minimized, and even if you manage to force it to draw it still won’t work, it will only work for off-screen windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Get Canvas/DC in minimized program?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

you can use the hook windows vista uses for when u scroll over a window in the taskbar (even if behind something, shows you an image of) however im not sure how to go about it :p! but i know it can be done.

Read full topic

item.title: Get Canvas/DC in minimized program?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Could you not use findwindow to get the dc of the window?
Just manually get it’s name, then when you need to get it just search for it.

Read full topic
